The new collaboration between the naval architects Tanguy Le Bihan and Patrick Tableau gives birth to this new hull christened the "wave splitter". It's extremely narrow stern is specifically conceived to slice through the waves in all sea conditions, and its flare allows extra safe passage.

Specifically designed to be equipped with a Volvo IPS drive, the MC5 offers a choice between the IPS 500 or the IPS 600.

The perfect combination between the hull and the selected engines makes the MC5 a boat that offers the best performance currently on the market.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
This Beneteau Barracuda 9 is being sold with such low hours as the owner was not able to use after delivery due to personal circumstances.  This particular model is rigged with a flybridge and twin Yamaha 200 HP outboards and a wonderful custom Garmin Electronics Package. This boat retails for nearly $200,000 and the Owner wants it sold now.

Other appealing features are:

  • Garmin 8" MFD w/ Yamaha Gateway
  • Garmin VHF 
  • Bow Thruster
  • Anchor Windlass
  • 25 hours

Call to see this boat today!

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Manufacturer Provided Description
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
With Barracuda, discover a new way of enjoying cruising and the “fishing” sprit: a true trend-setter, firm choices have been made:

The choice of the outboard engine for quick travel to fishing sites.
The choice of a wheelhouse and a simple central console for greater comfort.
And the choice of a modular boat depending on fishing habits and practices.

Thought up, designed and developed, taking into consideration brand values: seafaring qualities, design, safety and innovation. 

Rapidity, performance, safety and design. These key words class the Barracuda among the boats for sea adventurers, keen on well mastered power.

Whether it's competing on the race course or simply getting to the next harbor a lot faster than usual the striking performance of her Farr Yacht design hull and her powerful rig will deliver the "rush" you crave. Stable and well-mannered, fast before the wind; the First 40 is surely one of the great secrets of what sailing is all about.

Winner of 1st and 2nd place in the famed Sydney-Hobart Ocean Race, and taking fleets by surprise in Europe, call today for more information this hot new design from Beneteau.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
The Beneteau "Sense" 50 is a truly new and revolutionary design. Give full expression to all your senses, beginning with the pleasure of living on board a contemporary yacht with a totally innovative design. One does not need to be a great sailor to enjoy the happiness of life at sea and discover new horizons, sense is moving the boundaries of pleasure. From stem to stern, you will be surprised by the extremely well thought-out organisation of your life aboard with a sense of well-being, simplicity and beauty.

Enjoy living closer to the water in a much larger cockpit with easy and direct access to the water and great space for outdoor living and entertaining. The hard-chined hull is designed for fast sailing at reduced heeling angles. Three short stairs take you below to a "great room" with nav station, large U-shaped salon, and apartment sized galley. Forward you will find two spacious staterooms and an office space that can be a third private stateroom and two heads and two showers. All of the interior is bright and stylized to be comfortable for extended live-aboard comfort. T

Explore "Dock and Go"! Available with the the new revolutionary DOCK & GO system from Beneteau. Thanks to its joystick, which synchronises a pivoting saildrive base and bowthruster, DOCK & GO allows you to manoeuvre the Beneteau Sense 50 calmly, whatever the wind and tide or port layout. Fun and very intuitive, the system makes berthing the boat in a restricted space easy and gives a precision of movement without comparison.

Uniting safety and thrust, DOCK & GO combines the assistance of the engine and bowthruster, giving the same thrust both astern and ahead. Compatible with feathering or folding propellers, DOCK & GO optimises a yacht’s thrust for all-round manoeuvrability.

The Sense 50 is a new concept in boating. Call today for more information.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Beneteau Sense 50 Concept
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
BENETEAU has designed a lowered secure cockpit which positively alters life on board. Thanks to this innovation, the SENSE 50 combines stretched and flowing lines with ease of access to the sea and the salon. The ultra wide and spacious cockpit is designed to accommodate sailors and guests in novel and distinctive spaces, free from the constraints normally generated by aft cabins. Under the cockpit there is a technical area with tremendous storage; plus all the systems, machinery and deck equipment are brought together under the cockpit to ensure that noise is separated from the living area.

A well protected living space having perfect communication with the cockpit and outdoors: The companionway is extremely convenient, with access to the salon by just 3 steps with a 45°angle to provide safe and easy movement, while everywhere the generously wide hand rails ensure safety for movement on board. A wide glass area and openings on both sides of the companionway promote a sense of harmony allowing life below and above deck to blend seamlessly together.

Layouts: 2 cabins, 2 heads with a choice of a 3rd sleeping cabin or an office are available according to each owner's preference. Life after dark at the forward end of the boat: bed and bathrooms. The owner's bedroom and that of his VIP guests have ensuite bathrooms with a separate shower. This means that the cabins are better ventilated and privacy is emphasized with the bedrooms insulated from cockpit and dock noise. These choices confirm the commitment of SENSE to provide increased levels of comfort to the owners and their guests.

On board SENSE, priority is given to the pleasure of being on the water including an innovative deck plan with the controls (winches, halyards, genoa sheets, etc.) located aft of the relaxing cockpit area. The mainsheet is led back to a fixed arch which allows the companionway to be unrestricted.

SENSE is designed for sailing with complete freedom. · The fresh water capacity can be increased to 193 gallons. · The fuel tanks hold up to 219 gallons. · The boat is ready for renewable energies (solar, wind power) ô€‚¾ SENSE for the self-sufficient travellers. SENSE is also adapted for tomorrow's technologies: · Hybrid engines · Boat-handling assistance with the Dock and Go

Additionally, SENSE has the option of a motorized companionway door, electric tables, electric blinds, 32" LCD LED pop-up TV, recharging station, generator, ice maker, dishwasher, and many other optional equipment items.

SENSE: seaworthy boats designed for sailing on a more even keel. Comfortable cruising does not have to mean restricting comfort and therefore pleasure to time at anchor or at a marina slip. The hull design has been created in collaboration with Berret Racoupeau Yacht Design, to deliver maximum performance at 15° heeling angle instead of the normal 20°. The advantage of this is clear - movement around the boat while sailing is safer and easier.

The trio of BENETEAU, Nauta Design, and Berret/Racoupeau together form a team of proven and complementary talents, who already have to their credit the complete renewal of the 9 models of the OCEANIS range.

The quality of the design being fundamental to the well-being of the crew, SENSE extends an invitation to view interiors that are elegant and contemporary in style. Alpi fruitwood finish with defined pleasing grain, bleached oak laminated cabin sole, homestyle upholstery, synthetic resin work surfaces with built in sinks and high-tech equipment have been selected with care in collaboration with the Nauta design studio. As a nod to multi-functionalism; certain items fold away when not in use such as the stovetop, TV, seats, etc. The SENSE 50: a seaworthy yacht which provides owners and their guests an exceptional quality of life on board.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: DOCK AND GO
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The revolutionary DOCK & GO system makes manoeuvring your Sense 50 in close quarters complete child’s play.

Gone is the stress of manoeuvring in harbour. BENETEAU has launched DOCK & GO, an exclusive innovation to bring your boat alongside with complete peace of mind.

BENETEAU re- invents boat handling
By allowing yachtsmen to have access to the most complicated harbour berths, BENETEAU is removing a huge burden from sailors’ enjoyment of being on the water and lifting the apprehension felt about manoeuvring. A child would be able to bring a Sense 50 or Oceanis 50 alongside her berth, in complete confidence.

An intuitive joystick makes berthing precise, safe and fun.

Thanks to its joystick, which synchronises a pivoting saildrive base and bowthruster, DOCK & GO allows you to manoeuvre a large sailing yacht calmly, whatever the wind and tide or port layout.

Fun and very intuitive, the system makes berthing the boat in a restricted space easy and gives a precision of movement without comparison.

Uniting safety and thrust, DOCK & GO combines the assistance of the engine and bowthruster, giving the same thrust both astern and ahead. Compatible with feathering or folding propellers, DOCK & GO optimises a yacht’s thrust for all-round manoeuvrability.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Remarks and Disclaimer
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The Sense 50 is a wonderful new addition to the Beneteau boat line-up. If the combination of performance, closeness to the water, and larger than usual indoor and outdoor living spaces is important to you, please call to learn more.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
On deck, the 31 features a spacious cockpit with teak inlaid seats and an integrated walkthrough helm seat to access the swim platform. A pressure hot and cold shower makes rinsing off the salt a pleasure! All lines are led aft making for ease of short- or single-handed sailing. The helm sports a comfortable, leather-wrapped wheel with a Raymarine GPS Chartplotter on the pedestal.

Step below to find a light and airy main salon with galley immediately to port and head, with integrated shower, to starboard. The galley offers plenty of counterspace, a two-burner propane stove, generous 26 gallon refrigeration and microwave. The nav station is just forward of the head and leads to the spacious, comfortable salon/dining area with centerline collapsible table and settees suitable for sleeping. Just forward of the main salon you'll find the vee berth which sleeps two on comfortable mattresses and soft pillows. Aft of the galley is the second stateroom offering extreme comfort for two in an abeam-oriented double berth.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
World reknowned yacht builder, Beneteau, does it again!  The new Oceanis series of yachts delivers incomparable volume and a design with stretched, clear lines.  This new generation hull delivers comfortable, fast sailing.

Key Features:

A continuous chine hull:  This design provides for stiff performance on a slight heel while being fast, and providing a comfortable, very wide cockpit with a spacious forecabin.

More light than ever before and wonderful ventilation. The Oceanis line brings PMMA door and companionwah hatch with plexiglass windows to either side of the campanionway maximizing light and views below.

Electric opening transom: When opened, the transom becomes a spacious bathing platform making the entire cockpit open for wonderful use and connection to the sea. When closed, the transom becomes a helm seat protection the cockpit and increasing the interior volume.

Fixed arch provides a balanced sail plan allowing the mast to be set back 50% of LOA. Better performance and balance that also reduces pitching. The repositioning of the mast allows for a more gradual companionway at only 45 degrees.

Sail drive engine = less noise, more power and Dock & Go compatible.

Call today and order a new 2014 ahead of the summer price increase !

The new Juan K designed Beneteau First 30 is a true Cross-Over and is quickly capturing the imagination of sailors everywhere who want a boat that is fast, and capable of competitive around-the-buoys racing AND also very comfortable for cruising.   This is a  TRUE cruiser/racer!     

The sexy, racy look to the outside with a long torpedo bulb at the bottom end of a narrow fin keel, open transom, mast set back for squared-topped mainsail, hard-chined hull for stiffness, twin rudders and edgy performance might make you think pure racing pedigree.   But the interior with two private staterooms, large main salon and galley and enclosed head convince you quickly this design will be great to cruise.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
The SENSE 55 was just introduced at the December 2011 Paris boat show and is receiving rave reviews.   Carrying the unique hard-chined hull form of her smaller 43' and 50' sisters, the Sense 55 has a racy/performance look and will only heel to 15% for more comfortable sailing.  She has an open transom for optimum access to the water and her huge cockit is ideal for entertaining a group of friends.  The gently sloping companionway ladder is just three steps down to the open layout salon/galley area so people below and people in the cockpit feel connected.   Large windows in the hull and deck and bright bulkhead coverings make this interior connected to the outside.  Three double staterooms and three heads and showers add to the accommodations below.  

The SENSE 55 is a brand new model which will make her debut at the Miami boat show in February 2012.   Contact us today for advance information and a chance to buy this first one in America at introductory pricing.

DealerParty.SpecialRemarksDescription:
Kevin Fraser Kevin developed a passion for boating as a child on Cape Cod. While a student at Massachusetts Maritime Academy (MMA), Kevin was a member of the offshore sailing team. Upon graduation from MMA, He served as a Deck Officer on Oil Tankers and as Captain on various Yachts and a racing sailboat. Later, Kevin worked for Lewmar Marine, selling winches and deck hardware to Large OEM's and Custom Race boats. He continues to use his USCG Master Mariner license to deliver boats, to and from Florida. Kevin currently sails competitively on a custom 55‚ racing sailboat. "If you would like to talk to me about a new or brokerage boat, please give me a call."

Mobile: 401-862-0297 and email: kevin@cape-yachts.com.

Kevin Fraser

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
CLASSIC MANTA RACING 28 FT HIGH PERFORMANCE, FISHING, FUN!!! Fresh twin Merc 250 EFI outboards, rewired, ready to run!! Manta Boats, for the last 30 years, has forged a great reputation for building not only high-end boats but high-performance as well. It holds onto its mission "to build a better boat everyday." Each boat is custom made to your specifications and they don't start building until they are positive that they have met them. Every boat is custom made from start to finish. Manta started with a dream to build a quality boat to sustain the pounding of the seas and the abuse from mother nature that would last for years to come. And through these years Manta has proved time and time again their boats to be a powerful force and in the process has won multiple Offshore World Championship races and National Championship titles.



Manta boats was founded and created over 32 years ago.boat to sustain the pounding of the seas and the abuse from mother nature that would last for years to come.

And through these years Manta has proved time and time again their boats to be a powerful force and in the process has won multiple Offshore World Championship races and National Championship titles.

Modernized silhouette that emphasizes a very fluid flybridge line, hull specifically designed for the choice of IPS engine (2 IPS 600), the Swift Trawler 50 also marks a significant development in the adaptation to the various ways of sailing and living on board. From the couple to the large family, all types of crews will find the proposed layout and attractive.

Tons of storage with a warm wonderful wood throughout. Aft of the berth to port is the separate shower stall and to starboard is the toilet and vanity.

There are two private staterooms aft . Both are wonderfully comfortable with wide double berths. She has another head with a separate shower stall Everyone is comfortable! 

This luxurious interior has been loved by her owner, she looks brand new and is very functional

<object width="360" height="226"><param name="movie" value="/videos/1/87/95/4378795_20141124211950000.mp4"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="/videos/1/87/95/4378795_20141124211950000.mp4" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="360" height="226"></embed></object>

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
$40,000 PRICE REDUCTION!   SELLER WANTS THIS BOAT SOLD! 

Nerissa is a beautiful and well-maintained Sport Express hardtop Legacy 40.  This Mark Ellis designed classic is known to deliver a soft stable ride with excellent tracking and with under water exhaust is both quiet and fume free underway.   Take short day excursions with all your friends or a long cruise north or south with your special someone.  With sleeping for up to five, this semi-custom New England styled express cruiser is comfortable and accommodating.

Outfitted to the max, Nerissa has twin Yanmar 440's with low hours.  Expect cruising speeds in the mid-20's.  Her Northern Lights generator, bow thruster, full electronics suite, two TV''s including TracVision for Direct TV, dual AC/heat systems, and cockpit bench fridge, all contribute to enhancing life on board.   There are berths for five but this is an ideal one couple boat with space for occasional guests.  Just the right amount of varnished exterior teak on cap rails and cabin house eye brows gives the boat the New England flair but keeps maintenance to a minimum.

The seller wants to move up so call today for a chance to see this very special listing. She is highly recommended.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Vessel Walk-Through
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The Owner's Cabin is forward and features a center island queen size berth with lovely bed covering and pillows.  The berth top is hinged for easy access to storage under including four pull out drawers.   A large locker to port has shelves and another large hanging locker to stbd is lined with aromatic cedar.  There is a third custom locker in the aft bulkhead and there are four "aircraft" lockers running under the deck fore and aft.   An overhead hatch and opening stainless steel portlights provide air and light.   The finish below decks is Herreshoff style with varnished mahogany trim and white Formica surfaces which add to the light and airiness of this area.

The HEAD is located to port and has access from the salon.  The head has a separate stall shower, Vacuflush toilet, and vanity with Corian counter and integral under-mounted Corian sink..  There is also an overhead hatch and opening portlight and a large mirror.  

The LOWER SALON sitting area features an "L" shaped settee which pulls out to convert to a second large sleeping berth.  The backrest of the settee hinges up to provide an upper bunk as well.   A privacy curtain pulls out from hidden storage to enclose the starboard side of the salon.  The custom table has a lovely inlay.  On the aft bulkhead in the salon is the custom electrical panel and cabinet with DVD player and stereo. 

  • Herreshoff look interior below with varnished mahogany trim and white bulkheads
  • Varnished teak and holly sole below
  • Reverse cycle AC/heat system - 12,000 btu below
  • Two TV's for up and down

Opposite to port is the GALLEY which is conveniently located at the foot of the companionway stairs.  The U-shape provides plenty of counter space which is enhanced by a custom hinged counter extension.  The galley features a 3 burner electric cooktop, under-counter AC/DC refrigerator/freezer, microwave/convection oven, and white Corian counters with integral under-mounted white Corian sink.  There are two large dry storage areas and additional lockers for galley gear and dishes.

  • Princess Ceran three burner electric cooktop
  • Sharp Carousel Grill2 Convection microwave oven
  • Tundra T32 under-counter refrigerator / freezer - AC and DC
  • White Corian counters with integrated white Corian sink
  • Custom hinged white Corian counter extension
  • Ample lockers and storage

The HELM/BRIDGEDECK area has an oversize Stidd helm seat and helm electronics console to starboard, dedicated Stidd pedestal navigators seat to port, an L-shaped settee to port with removable triangular table and back enclosure which may be opened or removed in nice weather to enhance connectivity between the helm and aft cockpit.  The wood in the bridgedeck area is satin varnished teak and there are gloss varnish accents on the windows and back laminated curves.  The aft cockpit is large and has a large insulated refrigerator/freezer box and  removable teak table. 

  • Two Stidd pedestal seats upholstered in Ivory Ultraleather with optional cup holders built-in
  • TV in fold-down box
  • Reverse cycle AC/ heat system - 16,000 btu

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Electronics
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
• Furuno NavNet VX2 Chartplotter with C-Map NT Max chart chip
  • Furuno radar views on chartplotter
  • Furuno GP36 GPS
  • Furuno FCV 600L Fishfinder
  • Simrad AP22 autopilot
  • Icom IC-M402 VHF radio 
  • Raytheon ST 60 Speed 
  • Raytheon ST 60 Depth
  • Zenith 15" LCD TV in main salon
  • Samsung SynchMastet 151MP 13" LCD TV on bridgedeck installed in flip-down teak box
  • KVH Tracvision 4 SAT TV antenna
  • RCA Direct TV
  • Panasonic DVD /VCR
  • Shakespeare Sea Watch style 2025 Digital TV antenna
  • Fusion MS-CD600 AM/FM/CD Stereo with Sirius/XM
  • Alpine speakers in cabin and Clarion speakers in cockpit
  • Auxiliary input for music

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Mechanical - Electrical - Plumbing
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
MECHANICAL

  • Twin Yanmar 440's for great performance - 695 hours as of 8-27-14
  • ZF transmissions
  • Single lever engine controls
  • Racor fuel filters 1000MA
  • Groco ARG 2000S sea strainers for engines and Groco ARG 750 sea strainers for Air conditioning and generator
  • PSS dripless shaft seals
  • Under Water Exhaust for fume free ride
  • Excellent engine room insulation for low noise levels
  • Glendinning engine synchronizer
  • Bennett trim tabs with control and level indicator at helm
  • Fyquench Fireboy FE 241 fire extinguisher for engine room
  • Northern Lights 8kw generator - 934 hours
  • Reverso oil changing pump system
  • Steering is Hynautic hydraulics with varnished teak rimmed Stazo wheel
  • Spare props installed in storage boxes in the cockpit lazarettes

ELECTRICAL

  • Custom AC/DC electrical breaker panel with volt and ammeters
  • 50 amp AC shorepower service with 50 amp shore cord and 50/30 amp adapter
  • Prosine 1800 watt inverter
  • Truecharge 40+ multi-stage battery charger
  • Two 8D AGM batteries in house bank - CCA 1,450 (new 2010)
  • Two 4D AGM batteries for engine starting - CCA 1,110
  • Paralleling switch at helm
  • Sidepower Bowthruster with touch control pad at helm
  • ACR model RCL100 Searchlight with remote control at helm
  • Muir electric anchor windlass with control at helm and on deck
  • Marine Air 16k and 12k BTU reverse cycle air conditioning heat for bridedeck and interior 
  • Three Hella electric interior fans
  • Hubbell TV/phone connector outlet in cockpit
  • Six courtesy lights in cockpit, bridgedeck,and foredeck bulwarks
  • Reading lights and overhead lights
  • Caged engine room lights
  • 12vDC plug at helm and in engine room
  • GFI protected 120 v AC outlets
  • Kahlenberg dual trompet air horns
  • Three windshield wipers with washers
  • Three electric bilge pumps with high water alarms and alarm indicator
  • Frigid-Rigid refrigerator/freezer (your choice) in cockpit with cushions

PLUMBING

  • Jabsco Par Max pump with accumulator tank for hot and cold pressure water
  • Seaward 11 gallon stainless hot water heater heats from engine and 110AC
  • Skandvik cockpit shower
  • Sealand Vacuflush toilet with fresh water flush
  • Sealand macerator pump for holding tank discharge
  • Tankwatch holding tank full indicator
  • Bronze sea cocks and through hulls - bonded
  • Head discharge through hull has custom lock off mechanism
  • Fresh water washdown at anchor locker and in cockpit
  • Grohe fixtures in head sink and shower
  • Manual bilge pump in addition to three electric bilge pumps

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Hull and Deck
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
HULL:   Nerissa has a white gel coat hull with dark green boot stripe.  Her decks are white with sand contrasting non-skid.  The Sport Express hardtop model has the rakish good looks with all the right proportions and the curves aft draw you into the bridgedeck area and add a lovely style in profile.

The Legacy 40 hull has a narrow entry forward for a soft ride.  The flat sections aft provide stability and work to prevent bow rise for an optimum sight line from the helm at every speed.  The skeg adds to tracking.   Under Water Exhaust gives fume free performance.   Comfortable at displacement speeds, this Legacy with twin Yanmar 440's is fast.

  • Rub rails in solid fiberglass with stainless steel half rounds
  • Swim platform in fiberglass
  • Transom door
  • Telescoping swim ladder
  • Oversize hawes pipes in stern to allow electrical cord to pass through

DECK

  • Custom Sport Express hardtop with stylized curves aft
  • Canvas back enclosure
  • Wide side decks
  • Stainless steel bow rail with yacht club burgee staff base welded
  • Long stainless grab rails along lower coach roof and along underside of upper roof on side decks
  • Varnished teak cap rails and eye brows on the cabin house
  • Two rod holders
  • Deck courtesy lights in the bulwarks forward and in the cockpit aft
  • Center windshield opens with electric actuator
  • Opening side windows
  • Two overhead deck hatches over the helm and companion seats
  • Three overhead deck hatches below over the owners berth, in the head, and in the main salon
  • Six stainless opening portlights
  • White power-coated mast for antenna on coach roof
  • Large FrigidRigid refrigerator or freezer (your choice) in cockpit with Sunbrella cushions
  • St Croix dinghy davits - stainless steel and removable 600 # rating (new 2006)
  • Air conditioning and TV on bridgedeck area
  • Stidd oversized helm seat and Stidd companion seat - both with optional cup holders - Ivory Ultraleather
  • Bridgedeck settee upholstered in ultra-leather has storage under
  • Access to bridgedeck settee storage from aft
  • Large varnished teak aft cockpit table may be set up or stored in a lined bag in the locker

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Additional Information
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
• Custom Canvas winter cover with frame is included
  • Manuals available and conveniently organized in binders
  • Coast Guard safety package included
  • Fenders and dock lines
  • 45# CQR anchor with chain and rope rode
  • Boat hook
  • Lifesling
  • American flag with varnished flag staff
  • Weems and Plath barometer and clock and tide clock are included

AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:

<object width="360" height="226"><param name="movie" value="/videos/1/86/10/4418610_20130823144118000.mp4"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="/videos/1/86/10/4418610_20130823144118000.mp4" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="360" height="226"></embed></object>

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
OTTER is a very special traditional yacht in absolute turn-key condition.  She has the gorgeous lines of the classic double-ender and is the kind of boat you row away from with great pride of ownership.   Otter's currrent owner has lavished upgrades and maintained her to the highest standards since he bought her in 1991.  She has enjoyed heated indoor storage and the best professional care.

Significant upgrades include an In-Boom furling main which is managed by an electric winch.   Also, the hull and deck have been painted in Awl Grip and with the exterior teak varnished to a high gloss, the boat looks brand new.   A Yanmar diesel was installed by the builder in 1994 and looks like new.

Call today for a chance to see the classic beauty and take advantage of this owner's care and thoughfulness.   Otter is highly recommended.    The owner is motivated to sell and has just lowered the price by $10,000 - again.   This is a great value and you will not be disappointed in viewing her.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Otter is a very traditional cruising boat with a lovely aesthetic appeal.  Down below you will find a large vee berth with insert in a private forward cabin.  There is an overhead deck hatch and two opening portlights in this space for air and light.   There are a number of drawers and bins and storage under the berth.   Full length shelves and teak slats lines the hull sides. 

Just aft to port is a large cedar-lined hanging locker.  Across to port is the head with Wilcox Crittendon manual marine toilet, brushed stainless steel sink, hot and cold pressure water and shower.  There is an opening port in the head and a teak grate.

The main salon has straight settees that pull out to single berths.  There is a single pilot berth outboard to port and lockers and a bookcase to starboard.  A two-leaf table hinges up out of the way and down to sit six for dinner.  A solid fuel cabin heater is mounted on the forward bulkhead.  

The galley is just aft to port and features a three burner CNG stainless stove with oven and broiler.  There is a large ice box, stainless steel sink, hinged counter extension, and plenty of storage.  

Across to port is an aft facing nav station with bottle storage under.   A VHF radio, GPS chartplotter, and stereo are mounted here.   A wet locker is open to the companionway and there is an electrical panel and breaker switches under the companionway bridgedeck overhang.

  • Varnished teak interior
  • Varnished teak overhead and hull ceiling strips
  • Ultrasuede fabric cushions throughout in red with blue fitted cover sheets
  • Two overhead hatches and seven opening portlights
  • Ratelco Model 1655 Cole Stove Cabin heater
  • Chelsea Boston clock
  • Tons of storage everywhere
  • Princess stainless steel CNG three burner stove with oven and broiler

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Electronics
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
• Garmin GPS Map 182 chartplotter
  • Datamarine wind speed and direction, boat speed, depth, and log
  • Icom ICM 304 VHF radio
  • Jensen MSR 3012 stereo / cd player
  • Two C. Plath Merkur bulkhead mount compasses on port and stbd cockpit bulkheads

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Mechanical - Electrical - Plumbing
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Mechanical:

  • Yanmar 3JH2E 38 hp diesel - no hour meter - installed 1994
  • Groco sea strainer
  • Bronze intake seacock
  • Dual lever controls in cockpit with stainless steel guard

Electrical:

  • Custom electrical breaker panel with battery selector switch
  • DC voltage meter
  • Two battery banks - one battery each bank
  • Two 12vDC two-prong plug outlets - cockpit and forward cabin

Plumbing:

  • Water pressure - hot and cold
  • Wilcox Crittendon manual marine toilet
  • Y-Valve for overboard discharge
  • Holding tank with Jabsco macerator pump for discharge offshore
  • Rule 1000 electric bilge pump with float switch
  • Manual bilge pump in cockpit

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Deck and Hull
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Otter's hull and deck are both painted in Awl Grip and look like new.  The hull is white with a dark blue whale stripe. The deck is white with an ivory non-skid.   The varnished bow sprit, eye brows, grab rails, toe rails,coamings, and companionway slider and sea hood are all gloss varnished and look great.   This traditonal double ender is visually stunning. 

  • Stainless steel bow and stern rails
  • Double lifelines with pvc coated wire
  • Lifeline gate to starboard
  • Two stainless steel bow cleats and chocks with a centerline stainless cleat aft
  • Recent vintage Lewmar forward cabin hatch
  • Lovely varnished butterfly hatch over the main salon
  • Track forward of the mast for self tacking jib - Note the owner does not have the club boom or self tending sail. 
  • Genoa tracks outboard on the toe rails.
  • Two Lewmar # 8 winches on the mast for the halyards
  • Two Barient # 27 two speed, self-tailing primary winches in the cockpit
  • One Electric two speed Andersen # 28 to stbd for the main halyard and furling boom spool line
  • One Andersen two speed # 28 winch to port
  • Traveler in the cockpit for optimum control. Main sheet with 4:1 purchase
  • Lewmar clutch stoppers added for the main halyard and spool line
  • Four deep cockpit lockers
  • Recent dodger in tan Sunbrella
  • Cockpit shade in tan Sunbrella - has never been rigged
  • Outboard motor lift
  • Removable side-mount swim ladder
  • Teak grate in cockpit
  • Tiller steering - varnished tiller with tiller extension
  • Delta 22 # plow anchor with chain and rope rode on bow anchor roller
  • Danforth fluke anchor with secondary rode
  • Fenders, dock lines

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Rigging
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
This owner spent a lot of money to upgrade to an In-Boom main furling system and new main.  Couple with the two speed electric winch, this main is very easy to raise, lower, and reef and has an integrated sail cover. 

  • Schaefer In Boom furling system with sail - (approx 2003)
  • Schaefer genoa roller furling
  • Spinnaker
  • Three forward halyards including wire halyard for genoa plus two rope halyards
  • Spinnaker pole - aluminum
  • Whisker pole - aluminum
  • Track on leading edge of mast for poles
  • Traveler in cockpit
  • Rigid boom vang
  • Mast is single spreader - masthead rig - deck stepped - aluminum
  • Flag halyards at stbd spreader and up backstay
  • Running rigging excellent condition

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Broker Comments and Disclaimer
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The buyer has lavished upgrades and profesional maintenance on the first quality yacht.   He is not using her now and reluctantly is ready to let her go to a new owner who will appreciate her fine lines and traditional appeal.   Take advantage of this owner's diligence and buy a classic that is really ready to go cruising today.   

While most gear on board conveys with the sale, the buyer may find seller's personal gear on board as well which will not go with the boat.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription: The Oceanis 381 is a performance sailing yacht which corresponds well to Beneteau's philosophy on cruising. The lines of the hull are taut and the efficient hull shape guarantees that she will be a pleasure to helm, especially when cruising with the family. This offering features, autopilot, electric windlass, custom dodger. a full cockpit enclosure with screens and much more. Also, the owner continuously upgraded Ode to Joy. This was a fresh water boat for the first 11 years of ownership. She even has a custom winter cover!!

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Her layout is an "owners" version with two large double cabins and an L-shaped galley to port. The main salon features a dinnette which converts into a double berth and a bench seat opposite. Her forward cabin has a wash basin and vanity with a hanging locker and storage space.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
BROKEN ARROW offers a unique opportunity to own a Three Stateroom performance cruiser that could easily double up for some round the buoys fun.   Day sail Narragansett Bay or cruise with your family to the Islands - Broken Arrow has a fast hull shape, shoal keel for gunkholing, a large cockpit and with three staterooms, you can take your family or friends.

Cared for by a knowledgeable owner who has made continuous upgrades her equipment includes new interior Ultrasuede cushions, new Edson steering system, Raymarine C80, updated autopilot, new dodger, new main sail cover, full sail inventory, and many  desirable features.  

The seller has enjoyed this boat immensely but finds he no longer has time for her and is ready to let her go.    Call today for more details and an appointment to see this recommended high-value yacht..

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Broken Arrow is a very good condition and well updated Beneteau First 375,  There are three staterooms with sleeping for 6-8.   There is a large Vee Berth forward with insert: fabric is blue Ultrasuede. The forward cabin includes a hanging locker to port, storage lockers and shelves and additional storage under the berth.  There is an opening hatch overhead.  Note that the current owner has removed the door to the forward cabin but that is available and can be reinstalled for the new owner.

In the Main Salon, there is a straight settee to stbd and a U-shaped settee to port.  Both are upholstered in blue Ultrasuede and have lee cloths.  A dinette table has two drop-leaves to sit six or more for meals. The table has a space for liquor bottle storage. There are bookcases to port and starboard and cabinets and additional liquor storage to port.  An overhead opening hatch, skylight, two fixed side windows and two opening portlights all add air and light to the space.

Just aft to port is a large U shaped Galley - well positioned near the companionway and also open to the salon.The galley features a double basin stainless steel sink, ice box with SeaFrost 12vDC refrigeration, two burner propane stove with oven, and tons of storage and counter space.  Galley gear includes pots, pans, silverware, and utensils.   Across to stbd is a forward facing Navigation Station.  An electrical panel and secondary electronics are located here. There is storage under the nav seat.   Just aft is the Head which was updated by Hinckley recently.  There is a new Whale faucet and shower fixture installed.  

On either side of the companionway there are two Private Aft Staterooms.  The port aft stateroom has a large double berth and three opening portlights open to this cabin.  There is a hanging locker and also access to the back and side of the engine.  The stbd aft cabin has over and under bunks.  The upper bunk is a shelf now but the cushion is new and available.  Both aft cabin berths are upholstered in dark blue Sunbrella.

  • Ultrasuede cushions new (2011)
  • Custom bookshelves and liquor cabinet port side by Hinckley Yachts
  • Teak and Holly sole varnished by Hinckley Yachts
  • Interior is satin varnished teak

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
With Barracuda, discover a new way of enjoying cruising and the “fishing” spirit: a true trend-setter, firm choices have been made:

The choice of the outboard engine for quick travel to fishing sites.
The choice of a wheelhouse and a simple central console for greater comfort.
And the choice of a modular boat depending on fishing habits and practices.

Thought up, designed and developed, taking into consideration brand values: seafaring qualities, design, safety and innovation. 

Rapidity, performance, safety and design. These key words class the Barracuda among the boats for sea adventurers, keen on well mastered power.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
World reknowned yacht builder, Beneteau, does it again! Debuting this October in Annapolis at the International Sailboat Show, the new Oceanis 41 continues to deliver incomparable volume and a design with stretched, clear lines. This new generation hull delivers comfortable, fast sailing.

Key Features:

A continuous chine hull: This design provides for stiff performance on a slight heel while being fast, and providing a comfortable, very wide cockpit with a spacious forecabin.

More light than ever before and wonderful ventilation. The Oceanis line brings PMMA door and companionwah hatch with plexiglass windows to either side of the campanionway maximizing light and views below.

Electric opening transom: When opened, the transom becomes a spacious bathing platform making the entire cockpit open for wonderful use and connection to the sea. When closed, the transom becomes a helm seat protection the cockpit and increasing the interior volume.

Fixed arch provides a balanced sail plan allowing the mast to be set back 50% of LOA. Better performance and balance that also reduces pitching. The repositioning of the mast allows for a more gradual companionway at only 45 degrees.

Sail drive engine = less noise, more power and Dock & Go compatible.

Plan a visit with us today to see this wonderful new series of Oceanis yachts.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
To increase the First Twenty's speed and performance all the more, this year, she has been equipped with a rigging that will perpetuate her appeal, with a square-top mainsail and genoa whose area is greater, and a self-supporting mast without a stay.Thanks to this new rigging, which frees the lower shrouds, access to the fore is no longer hindered, making circulation on deck much easier. This is particularly appreciable on a boat of this size.To adhere to the trend that favours asymmetric sails, the First Twenty standard is equipped with a polyester bow sprit.

TheFirst Twenty has a harder sleeker look and has gained modernity.Decked out in its new finery, the First 21.7 will probably continue to play in the big league for many years to come!

EmbeddedData.DataString: <object width="360" height="226"><param name="movie" value="/videos/1/20/91/4432091_20130823145648000.flv"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="/videos/1/20/91/4432091_20130823145648000.flv" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="360" height="226"></embed></object>

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription: Cygnet is a beautiful example of this David Pedrick designed cruiser from the well respected New England builder Freedom Yachts.   Many feel that the exterior and interior layouts on the Freedom 35 are the best available in their size and class.   Features include a swim platform, walk-through transom, self-tending sailplan, easy stairway access to the interior, aft head with stall shower, all stainless steel opening portlights, skylights, and two extra large staterooms. On Cygnet, a two speed electric winch makes sail handling a snap and the blue hull is a real standout in any harbor.  If you are looking for an exceptional performer, that is designed for short-handed sailing, that also has the optimum fin keel and offers sleeping for six then the Cygnet might be the boat for you.  Call today for a chance to see her for yourself.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
This design has a large interior for its size. There is a Vee Berth with insert forward with hanging and shelf locker storage to port and starboard. Just aft in the Main Salon is a settee berth to starboard and an "L" shaped settee to port which converts to a berth. Also to port is bulkhead-mounted two-leaf dinette table that folds down to accommodate 6 for dinner. There is storage under the stbd settee and behind the back rests and also custom cherry cabinets are mounted above the shelves to port and starboard.  Just aft of the stbd settee is a Navigation station with stand-up chart table, electrical control panel and electronics outboard. The Head is aft to starboard and includes a separate stall shower. Across from the head and adjacent to the companionway stairs is an "L" shaped Galley and aft of the galley is the Owners Cabin with a double, athwartships berth with headboard cushion.

There are lockers, drawers, and shelves for storage throughout this boat. There are also 12 stainless steel opening portlights, 5 deck hatches, and 2 skylights for maximum ventilation and light.  This is a light and airy boat with lovely oil-based varnished cherry and varnished teak and holly flooring that creates a warm and inviting interior. The door frames and galley riser cap are custom laminated cherry and ash alternating colors and provide a wonderful accent.  Cushions are all upholstered in light blue Ultrasuede fabrics,

Galley includes:

  • Force 10 two burner stainless steel propane stove with oven and broiler
  • Double basin polished stainless steel sink
  • Two section ice box with Adler Barbour refrigerator/freezer
  • Nice storage cabinets

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Electronics
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
• Garmin GPS 75 at nav station
  • Garmin GPS 76 at helm (mounted but not operating)
  • Apelco VHF radion at nav station
  • Raytheon ST 5000+ linear drive autopilot
  • Autohelm wind display works but is off 30 degrees
  • Autohelm speed display
  • Autohelm depth display 
  • Sony CDX 5270 stereo-cd player with Sony speakers in cabin and cockpit
  • Ritchie binnacle compass

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Mechanical - Electrical - Plumbing
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The engine is located amidships under the port settee for unbeatable access. This area is well insulated and includes a blower. The engine is the tried, true, and reliable Yanmar 3GM30F with cylinder compression release levers for easy starting.

  • Yanmar 3GM 30F 27 hp diesel - engine has compression release levers for easier starting if the battery is low
  • Three blade feathering MAX prop
  • Single lever engine control at pedestal
  • PSS dripless shaft seal
  • Racor fuel filter and water separator

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Deck - Hull - Rigging
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Cygnet's hull is dark blue with double white boot stripes and a white cove stripe. The deck is white with ivory colored contrasting non-skid. This is a very clean traditional look.

All lines lead through stoppers to the cockpit. The deck is clean and easy to maintain with NO TEAK beyond the step on the swim platform.  Portlights, stanchions, grab rails,bow and stern rails,and cowl vents are all 316 grade quality stainless. Stanchions and double lifelines are higher than industry standard for added safety. Boarding gates to port and starboard. The cockpit includes a walk-through transom and easy access to the companionway stairs for getting below. Integral anchor locker on foredeck keeps mud and water from inside the boat. Built in stainless steel dorade vents add fresh air to the cabin even when the boat is closed up.

The mast is the free-standing, carbon fiber spar for which Freedom is so well known. The main is fully battened and has two built in reefs which are fully set from the safety of the cockpit. The jib has the standard Camberspar for easy self-tacking and self tending and this will wing out automatically on a run. Ask the broker about the Freedom "man-over-board drill" and also the safety of sailing a Freedom dead down-wind. Sail cover for the main is recent and is integrated to the sail.  The cockpit cushons are white vinyl.  There is a rigid boom vang for extra control and safety and lazy jacks control the sail and sail cover when it's lowered. All sail controls are lead to the cockpit through clutch style deck stoppers and all sail handling can be managed from the cockpit on a two speed electric winch.

Deck:

  • Double anchor roller
  • Anchor locker
  • Stainless steel bow and stern rails
  • Double lifelines have extra high stanchions and uncovered lifeline wire
  • Lifeline gates are installed to port and starboard
  • 5 deck hatches
  • 12 opening stainless steel portlights with screens - all have curtains
  • 2 skylights
  • Stainless steel bow, midships, and stern cleats - all with chocks
  • Rigid boom vang mounted to stainless compression ring
  • Harken turning blocks
  • Harken 4:1 traveler
  • Harken # 44 two speed self tailing electric winch
  • Harken # 42 two speed self tailing winch
  • Dodger - Linen color Sunbrella
  • Bimini with storage boot -Line color Sunbrella
  • White vinyl cockpit cushions
  • Oversize steering wheel with leather cover
  • Cockpit table in white Starboard material with two folding leaves
  • Cup holders in white Starboard
  • Stainless steel swim ladder
  • Delta 22# Fast Set anchor with chain and three strand rope rode
  • Fenders with covers
  • Dock lines
  • Horseshow
  • Wood outboard bracket on stern rail
  • Life jackets
  • Boat hook

Sails:

  • Fully battened main - Quantum
  • Harken Batt Car mast luff track system for ultimate low friction
  • Camberspar jib
  • Integral mainsail cover with lazy jacks and zipper for closure

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Brokers Comment and Disclaimer
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Cygnet is being made available for sale by her original owner who has maintained her to the highest standards with the most experienced Freedom service person in New England.  She has been lightly used for Northeast cruising but the owners plans are changing and he no longer has time to take advantage of all she has to offer.   

Buyer should anticipate that there may be owner's personal gear on board at the time of the inspection and gear on board that is not specifically listed may or may not be included.  Buyer is encourage to inquire about specifics but should assume if something is not listed then it is likely not to convey with the sale.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
This rare and beautiful Beneteau Antares 13.8 is a one owner boat. Travel plans have made this a bittersweet sale for the owner. She has all the goodies and has been well maintained since he purchased it new. This boat features incredible headroom throughout, a great family layout perfect for cruising! A bow thruster makes handling a snap!!

YOU GOTTA SEE THIS BOAT TO BELIEVE IT!!

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Overall description
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Comfortable, powerfull and stylish, the Antarès 13.80 brings genuine navigation pleasure together with a seaworthy and safe behaviour. She carries the latest, hi tech innovation in comfort for easy life aboard . Inside, the fabrics, aluminium, woodwork and colors have been choosen and harmonized to match the most prestigious motoryachts standards.Her two turbocharged engines allows a smooth and pleasant ride and a particularely low fuel consumption at cruising speed (2 x 54 L at 17 knots), while allowing a 30 knots plus max speed at full load.

The Antares 13.80, the flagship of the Beneteau Antares range, invites you aboard for a wonderful voyage - first class all the way. The combination of hull and engine design has given the Antares13.80 astonishing stability and maneuvrability. Life aboard, both inside and outside is sheer enjoyment.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
OFF CALL is a classic 36' cruiser from Beneteau.  With a large cockpit, walk- through transom, and spacious and bright two stateroom interior, OFF CALL is ideal for two or a family of six on extended cruises.   Easy to manage, she has roller furling genoa and also in-mast furling.   Electronics, ground tackle and cruising gear including refrigeration, freezer, microwave, electric anchor windlass, make this is a very desirable choice.  Recent updates include a new dodger, and new batteries.     Even the dishes will all go with the boat.

OFF CALL comes with a very recent dinghy and an outboard motor.   Call today for an appointment to see her for yourself.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Vessel Walk-Through
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The Beneteau 361 has two large private staterooms.  There is a Vee Berth forward with sliding door, hanging locker, 2 opening portlights, and an overhead deck hatch.   Just aft in the Main Salon is a long settee to port which is capped by a forward facing navigation table and seat.   To stbd is a large C-shaped settee which may be converted to a double bed.    Two windows in the hull, two opening ports, and a large overhead deck hatch make this area bright and airy.   The sides of the hull in the main salon are finished in wood strips.   Ample storage is found in lockers and under the settees.   Aft to port and adjacent to the companionway is a spacious U-shaped Galley with double basin stainless steel sink, large dry storage area, two burner propane stove with oven, under counter refrigerator, top-load freezer, and a microwave oven.  Ample storage and counter space makes meal prep a pleasure.   The galley has two opening ports and an overhead deck hatch.    Across from the galley to stbd is the Head and shower which features a vanity with mirror, manual marine toilet, and shower area with seat.     A curtain track is install and a shower liner curtain could be installed to completely separate these two areas.   Aft to stbd is a private double Aft Stateroom.  The extra large berth is oriented athwartships and makes a great place to escape and read.  Two opening ports, a hull window, and an overhead deck hatch provide plenty of light and ventilation.    A second hanging locker offers up additional storage.

  • Varnished teak interior wood
  • Varnished teak and thiocol sole
  • Hatches have shades
  • Head room ranges from 6' 4" to 6' 2".

  • First Wave gimballed, stainless steel, two-burner propane stove with oven

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
Blue Moon is a one-owner classic Beneteau 393 which was built in the Marion, SC factory in the US. She is laid out perfectly for cruising with the sought-after two cabin, two head layout, making cruising fun and comfortable for a family or the couple entertaining guests in style!

She comes with a full electronics suite including 2008 Raymarine E 80 color plotter, linear drive autopilot, VHF with command mic at the helm, and sailing instruments.  Roller furling genoa and "classic" main with integrated sail cover and lazy jacks are easy to handle and deliver optimum performance.  The wide beam, three skylights, seven overhead deck hatches, seven opening portlights and five hull ports make this boat very comfortable for you and your guests. 

The seller is down-sizing and this is a brand new listing.   Call today for a chance to see this very well kept Beneteau 393.

Seller will consider all offers!  Wants to sell before winter lay up.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The interior is bright and airy with seven overhead deck hatches, seven opening portlights, five fixed hull ports, and three large skylights. Matched with a warm and inviting varnished teak interior, blue upholstery, and teak varnished sole, Blue Moon is a great boat for both northern and southern sailing.

Forward is the Owner's cabin with a large double pullman berth to port with large drawers under and a dressing seat to stbd.  A large hanging locker adds to storage in this area.  In the bow and completely private to this fwd cabin is a Head and shower and sink with vanity. 

Aft in the Main salon is a large U-shaped settee to port with double bench inboard on the centerline. The dinette table converts to a berth. Across to stbd is a large storage area with lockers, drawers, and bins.  Just aft is a fwd-facing Nav Station with curved seat and chart table and electrical breaker panel.  

The U-shaped Galley is found in the port aft corner and is conveniently located adjacent to the companionway stairs and also open to the main salon without being in the way. The galley includes a two burner Force 10 stainless steel propane stove with oven, Tappan Microwave, Adler Barbour 12v under-counter refrigerator and top-load freezer, double basin stainless sink and large storage areas.

Interior Details:

  • All hatches have rolled shades integral
  • Weems and Plath clock is mounted main salon bulkhead
  • Dinette table converts:   boat sleepts 6

AdditionalDetailDescription.Description: Based on the highly successful Beneteau 473 and designed by renowned naval architects Berret/Racoupeau Yacht Design, this unique 39-foot passagemaker answers a long awaited quest for the serious bluewater cruiser. Roomier, more spacious and boasting some of the best accommodations to be found, the 393 will be sure to please the most scrupulous of sailors; flawlessly combining comfort and performance into an exceptional vessel.

The Beneteau 393 hull is solid fiberglass which utilizes a structural grid throughout the bilges for added stiffness and support.    The hull is white with dark blue stripes and a black bottom paint.  The Decks are cored fiberglass and are white with white non-skid pattern.   Numerous deck hatches, opening ports, fixed ports, and skylights add light and ventilation.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
"Usquebaugh" is a lovely example of the three stateroom - two head layout Oceanis 46.   Used for family cruises in New England she has very low hours and appears well kept.  Nicely outfitted, Usequebaugh has a furling main and genoa, bow thruster, feathering Max prop, marine hardwood decks,  Ultrasuede interior cushions, electric winch, inverter, anchor windlass, dodger, bimini with connector, solar panel, and many cruising extras.  A full electronics suite includes a Raymarine E120 chartplotter at the helm, sailing instruments at both wheels, linear drive autopilot, VHF radio and Command Mic and stereo / CD player.

Don't delay.  Call today for a chance to see her in person. 

$15,000 price reduction and offers are encouraged!

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Usquebaugh has the desirable three stateroom layout with a large double berth in the Fwd Cabin with an en suite head and stall shower.   A sitting area is located to stbd with a desk and vanity.   The Main Salon has a straight settee to stbd with a large U-shaped settee to port.  The dinette table may be lowered to convert to a large double bed.  Two stools on the center are able to move.   Aft of the stbd settee is a forward facing navigation table.    Aft to port is a spacious Galley with lots of counter space and storage.  The galley is conveniently located close to the cockpit and the main salon without being in the way.   There is a second head with access from the main salon and private access from the stbd aft cabin and this head also has a stall shower.  There are two double berth Aft staterooms to port and stbd.

Numerous deck hatches, windows, opening portlights, white finished surfaces, and skylights all contribute to making the interior bright and airy.  The varnished Moabi wood below is warm and inviting and the sold is long wearing high pressure laminate.

Bristol 35.5 Blue Phantom Interior from Fwd

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
Blue Phantom is just gorgeous.  Her owner has spared no expense in keeping her up at a well respected boat yard in New England.  Stored indoors through the winter, her care shows right away.  The hull paint glistens, the bottom paint is smooth and fresh, and the prop is polished.    Inside is the same with the varnished mahogany interior in lovely condition.   The Bristol 35.5 is a classic cruiser drawn with a wonderful line for very high aesthetic appeal and she will deliver excellent performance as well.

Blue Phantom is well equipped and highly updated.   Some of the upgrades include new main and genoa (2010), new Flag Blue hull Awl Grip (2011), new dodger (2011), new bimini (2012), new feathering Max prop (2012), new autopilot (2013), new VHF radio with AIS feature (2011), new Garmin GPS mounted at helm (2011), new stainless steel stove (2008) new upholstery throughout (2008), new polished stainless steel ports and window frames (2008) and much more.  

Please call for details and a chance to view her in person.   This boat is stored indoors so don't let the weather keep you home.  Highly recommended.    PRICE REDUCTION OF $17,500.   ALL OFFERS PRESENTED WILL BE CONSIDERED.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Blue Phantom has a beautiful varnished mahogany interior with varnished teak and holly sole.  The sole was stripped and revarnised four years ago.   There is a vee berth forward in a private cabin with direct access to the head and shower.  Aft in the salon are straight settees to port and stbd that pull out to convert to larger berths.  A two-leaf table folds up out of the way or easily folds down to sit six for dinner.   A nav table is positioned at the head of the port side quarter berth and there is a full galley to stbd with recent propane stove, refrigeration, hot and cold pressure water, and plenty of counter and storage space.  

  • Sleep 6-7

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
IF A DEAL IS ACCEPTED BY APRIL 15TH, A BRAND NEW AB DINGHY AND 4 HP YAMAHA OUTBOARD WILL BE INCLUDED FREE OF CHARGE. 

TRADES CONSIDERED!

When new, her orignal  owner invested over $750,000 to bring this 523 to complete bluewater racer/cruiser capability. Upgraded to offshore specifications to meet the rigorous standards of the 2010 Newport-to-Bermuda Race, she took 2nd in class (of 15) on her first attempt. Her equipment includes Quantum Racing sails, upgrade to Harken roller-furling system, all-electric Harken primary and halyard winches, generator, air-conditioning, Espar heat, high capacity watermaker, dual inverter system and much, much more.

Her second owners recently upgraded to new Raymarine HybridTouch electronics and a new cockpit dodger in 2013 to compliment the existing full cockpit enclosure..  They are trading in on a new boat.   She has been maintained to the highest standards and has been summering in RI and wintering in the USVI.  .


The three cabin layout, with a fourth crew cabin forward, provides comfortable stateroom accommodations for six guests. The owner's stateroom is forward with centerline queen island berth, ensuite head with stall shower, beautiful custom cabinetry, workstation with flat-screen television and ample hanging, drawer and locker storage storage. Two mirror image aft staterooms, each with ensuite head, are outfitted with sizeable double berths, inner spring mattresses and plenty of hanging and shelf storage.


The spacious main salon, also outfitted with custom cabinetry, flat-screen television and comfortable leatherette fabric is the perfect gathering area for owner and guests. Seating for six or more surrounds her dining table to port while her galley, quite suitable for the gourmet, is to starboard. The galley sports double stainless sinks, four-burner ENO propane stove with oven, microwave, dual standup Vitrifrigo refrig/freezer units, custom pantry storage and plenty of countertop space.


Take a moment to click on "FULL SPECS".  Please call broker for details.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
FISH TO YOUR HEARTS CONTENT!!

Fish Tales is the ultimate fishing machine at a great price. The solid inboard engine makes the deck roomy enough to land that huge tuna!! Full compliment of electronics, maintenance records since new this one owner boat is sure to please the most discriminating fisherman around.

This beauty will easily fish 4 to 6 guys (or girls) in the huge cockpit. She actually caught a 448lb Thresher Shark during the monster shark tournament in 2011, so she is a proven winner!!

She is in the water and ready to go!!

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Manufacturer Provided Description
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description: The Shamrock 270 Open has a bow area that features a cavernous rope locker and bow pulpit with a roller and optional winch. The center helm features a footrest, deluxe instrumentation, dual binnacle controls, a hinged panel for easy access to dash wiring, and a large open dash area for mounting electronics. The spacious cockpit area features a large insulated fish box, coaming bolsters, and engine box seating with storage. The forward deck has a large insulated, removable fish box with macerator and overboard discharge, plus a 225-quart cooler. The transom has a 32-gallon baitwell, a swing-out transom door with heavy duty stainless steel hinges, and a flip-up gate. The bait prep station features a freshwater sink, cutting board, and tackle storage. Fresh and raw water washdown spigots and rod storage are located under the aft gunwales. Located inside the center console is a fully enclosed marine head with shower, sink and opening portside window. The sound insulated engine box lifts easily to accommodate engine inspections.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription: “Boston Cruiser” is a one owner, very lightly used Beneteau 343. She has been sailed, almost exclusively in Boston Harbor.  Designed by Berret-Recoupeau, the Beneteau 343 is the perfect boat for the sailing couple or smaller family. She is well set up for short handed sailing with a furling mainsail & headsail and all lines leading aft into the cockpit. The 343 provides standard features that few sailboats of her size offer.  Her interior is very light and airy with two staterooms and a comfortable seating/entertaining areas. Her galley is well suited for liveaboard with lots of storage areas and a large refer/freezer. Her head compartment is roomy with a separate shower stall.  . All designed to make cruising easier and more comfortable - no matter how many crew members are sailing with you.  Designed by Berret/Racoupeau, the new Beneteau 343 is targeted to appeal to the discerning owner who wishes to find a finely finished yacht at an attractive investment level.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Description: Beautiful cherry finished interior with laminate wood grain cabin sole, Soho Indigo fabric covered cushions, Private forward V-berth cabin with lockers P&S, U-shaped dinette to port in main salon with single settee to stbd., centerline drop leaf table, Aft facing nav station, Oversized head with vanity and separate shower area with seat aft to stbd., L-shaped galley, private aft cabin with large athwartships berth and hanging locker.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
Cruising at everyone's pace on seas the world over. Sailing single-handed, as a couple, with the family or with friends, the Oceanis 38 can make all sailing dreams come true. On board this yacht, sailing is free of needless constraints. Its very use has been redesigned to leave the owner the choice of layout. Designed to evolve, it can adapt to stages in life through the addition and subtraction of elements.

DAY SAILER, WEEKENDER, CRUISER, the Oceanis 38 adapts to three worlds and evolves to match your needs, desires, and lifestyle.

DealerParty.SpecialRemarksDescription:
Kevin Fraser Kevin developed a passion for boating as a child on Cape Cod. While a student at Massachusetts Maritime Academy (MMA), Kevin was a member of the offshore sailing team. Upon graduation from MMA, He served as a Deck Officer on Oil Tankers and as Captain on various Yachts and a racing sailboat. Later, Kevin worked for Lewmar Marine, selling winches and deck hardware to Large OEM's and Custom Race boats. He continues to use his USCG Master Mariner license to deliver boats, to and from Florida. Kevin currently sails competitively on a custom 55‚ racing sailboat. "If you would like to talk to me about a new or brokerage boat, please give me a call."

Mobile: 401-862-0297 and email: kevin@cape-yachts.com.

Kevin Fraser

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription: Warrior  is a meticulously maintained, 2004 Jeanneau SunFast 35. This immaculate Jeanneau Sun Fast 35, comes with a new 2013 Doyle Stack pack main and roller furling jib, along with a new Dodger and Bimini that was added in the Fall of 2013.The Sun Fast is a racer/cruiser model within the Jeanneau line of sailboats.  She is a fast cruiser, or racer with a very plush interior. She's one of the fastest under 38 feet boats with a luxury interior below. The Sun Fast models have the same, light real teak,  interior as the Sun Odyssey 35 cruiser from Jeanneau. But with all the "go fast" goodies like adjustable, backstay, Jib cars, and traveler in the cockpit for fine trimming.  This boat is easily handled by a couple or even single handed. The Flag blue hull is amazingly sharp and gets many "nice boat" comments.

This boat is the personal boat for Cape Yachts' owner and family it has been used gently and meticulously maintained and fitted with the finest features. This is a chance to get a fully appointed boat at an excellent price.

The world of luxury and generosity dominates the 49. Thought of in terms of modern architecture, it favors conviviality and superior comfort, and makes the perfect live-aboard thanks to top-notch amenities and equipment, just like at home!

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
Chicane is a lovely and well kept version of this classic Beneteau Oceanis cruiser.  She is both fast and comfortable.  With sleeping capacity for 6-7 and a large cockpit with swim platform, walk-through transom, and both genoa and in-mast furling she will accommodate your favorite crowd AND be easy to sail by yourself.  

The seller has purchased another boat already so Chicane is PRICED TO SELL!   Make an appointment today to see her.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Manufacturer Provided Description
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description: Designed by Groupe Finot, the Beneteau 331 offers a sophisticated hull with traditional lines. A spacious cockpit, top-of-the-line deck hardware, and a roller furling main accent her ease of handling. Standard features include refrigeration, excellent ventilation and additional electronics.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The Beneteau 331 is an ideal family cruiser that will accommodate 6-7 for overnights with a private double vee berth with insert, a private oversized double aft stateroom, a convertible dinette for intimate double and a single on the port settee.

The Vee Berth has a sliding door for privacy and a removable berth insert.  An overhead hatch with shade provides ventilation, light, and a way out if necessary.  This cabin has a hanging locker and shelves.     The Main Salon features a large U-Shaped settee to port with some storage under.  The dinette table slides down to make this stbd settee into a double bunk.  A straight settee to port has lots of storage under and ends in the aft facing Nav Station where the electrical panel is located. Aft to port is a very large U-shaped Galley with polished stainless steel double-basin sink, large dry storage locker, cabinets, drawers, stainless steel two-burner propane stove with oven, and large top load ice box with Adler Barbour refrigerator and freezer.  The Head and shower is opposite the galley and has a manual marine toilet, sink vanity, shower hose, and mirror and locker.  The Aft Stateroom is to stbd and has an oversized double bed where you can sleep either fore'n'aft or athwartships.   There is a hanging locker.

There are four opening overhead deck hatches with shades, a skylight, several fixed hull windows, and several opening portlights with screens and curtains all providing light and air into this bright and inviting space.  The varnished teak interior is in excellent condition and the cushions all appear in excellent condition.   The boat is move-in ready.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
Tradition is a very nice example of this long distance and live-aboard cruiser built to high standards in Ontario, Canada.  With her ketch rig she has a manageable sail plan that is easy to sail short handed. Espeically helpful is the installation of a Schaefer In-Boom mainsail furling system that is controlled by an electric halyard winch.  This was installed in 2006 with a new mainsail at that time.  The 120% genoa was new in 2010.

Accommodations include two private staterooms with two heads.  The salon has a large settee to port with two swivel easy chairs mounted to stbd by the nav station.  A bulkhead mounted table folds down to sit six for dinner.  A U-shaped galley is well set up for cooking underway and has plenty of counter and storage and refrigerator space.  

Well cared for and updated by knowledgeable yachting couple, they have decided to scale back and make Traditon available to you now.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
This long range center cockpit passage-maker features a very livable interior with two private cabins, two heads and a large salon and galley area.  The engine room is spacious so working on equipment there is comfortable. 

The Forward Cabin features a long and wide vee berth with an insert that can be stowed over the bunk on the overhead.  Ahead of the berth is access to the chain locker which has a divider to keep two anchor rodes separated.   The oiled teak finish is in nice shape and there are teak hull strips on the sides.  A large deck hatch opens over the berth and there is a folding stair on the bulkhead to assist exiting from this hatch.  There is also an opening portlight.  Drawers, a large hanging locker and six air craft lockers provide ample storage.

There is direct access to the Forward Head from this vee berth area.  There is a second access door from the salon.  The head is finished in white laminate so is bright and easy to clean.  There is a vanity sink,in brushed stainless, mirror, Raritan manual marine toilet, teak shower grate, shower, an opening portlight and a cowl vent for added ventilation.

The Main Salon is large and features two swiveling easy chairs to stbd that can be moved around or locked down to the sole.  There is a custom futon with cushion which may be removed to expose a nice end table.  Behind these chairs is a bar locker and other storage. A neat arrangement for a removable pipe berth is located to stbd.   To port is an L-shaped settee that pulls out to convert to a berth.  there is a two-leave table that folds up out of the way onto the forward bulkhead or down to sit up to six for dinner.  The mast is stepped on the keel but is hidden in a teak box on which a Weems and Plath oil lamp is mounted.  There are four opening ports and four fixed windows and an opening overhead deck hatch with all contribute to making this cabin light and airy and inviting. 

Aft to stbd is a forward facing Navigation Station with seat with storage under.  The large surface nav table is a great place to lay out charts.  The table has a unique which allows you to change the angle of the table slightly.  A waste basket is built-in to the cabinet under the chart table.

The Galley is a U-shape with a double basin brushed stainless steel sink on centerline with a cutting board insert.  There is a large dry storage locker in the counter and other lockers for food and pots and pans.  Five drawers and 3 bins add to the storage of this space.  A three burner Force 10 stainless steel propane stove with oven and broiler was installed in 2008 outboard.  This gimbels.   The ice box extends the length of the aft counter and has two top access doors and a single front access door.  This is cooled by Adler Barbour Super Cold refrigeration and a new compressor was installed in 2013.  Two spice racks are installed and there is a teak grate in the floor with a dust bin under for easy sweep up of the cabin. 

In the Passageway to the aft cabin there is 12vDC and 110vAC distribution panel.  Under the counters in this area is chart storage, a feature not found on more modern cruisers.  There is a wet locker for hanging foul weather gear right at the foot of the companionway ladder and access to the engine room is in this space with two doors.

The Owners Stateroom is aft and this area features a bed that can be set up as two twin beds to port and stbd or as a single large double bed for sleeping athwartshps. There is tremendous storage in two hanging lockers six aircraft lockers, and miscellaneous drawers and bins.  Five opening portlights and a companionway slider and ladder out to the cockpit make this area bright and well ventilated.   The en suite Aft Head is in white formica laminate and features a Raritan manual marine toilet, vanity sink, shower, and shower grate.  There is an opening portlight and dorage vent here.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
Rolling Tide is a great example of this Tartan classic.  She has a beautiful dark blue Awl Grip hull that will stand out in any harbor.    If you are looking for a fast, sea worthy cruiser with excellent pedigree this might be the boat.  

Well outfitted, Rolling Tide has a two GPS, autopilot, VHF, TV, stereo, refrigeration, propane stove, folding wheel at the helm, electric anchor windlass, Harken genoa furler, recent sails from 2007, Ultrasuede fabrics below,  two zone Reverse cycle AC/heat, and many more details.    

Rolling Tide is priced to sell this fall so call today for an appointment to see her in person.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The private Forward Cabin has a large vee berth with insert cushion, overhead hatch, and large lockers and drawers.  There is a flat screen TV and vanity with sink in the stbd corner of this cabin.  There is a hinged window in the forward bulkhead that can close for privacy or open to enlarge the interior living spaces.    

Just aft, the Main Salon features a U-shaped settee to starboard, straight settee to port which slides out to create an additional berth, and a lovely dinette table with two leaves for dining. 

The Galley is aft and has a 3 burner Force 10 gimballed LPG stove with oven and broiler, double stainless steel galley sinks - 9" deep, molded top and front load ice boxes with Isotherm refrigeration, built-in trash bin, hot and cold pressure water and manual fresh water pump. Extensive lockers, shelves and dovetail drawers.  Counters are green Corian and a hinged counter extension adds to the working surface. 

Across from the galley is a forward facing Navigation Station with storage under the seat.  The electrical panel is located here as is additional electronics.  

The Aft Stateroom is located to starboard and has a large double berth, lockers, and opening ports for ventilation. 

The Head has a separate stall shower, vanity with under-counter sink, and manual marine toilet.
