AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Hull and Deck
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Hull:   Manufacturer's Description: White NPG/ISO gelcoated hull, hand laminated with alternating layers of strand mat and uni-directional "E" glass locally reinforced. Fully cored with high strength, impact resistant synthetic core for stiffness with solid glass at all thru hull, chain plate and keel installations. Gelcoat backup layer is laminated and chemically bonded using a 4mm barrier coat of vinylester anti-corrosive resin for blister resistance. 90º throw flush thru-hull fittings. Bulkheads and floor timbers are bonded using advanced adhesive technology. Built to meet ABS Plan Certification.

  • Hinged swim platform may be up for closed transom or down for ease of access
  • Hull is Flag Blue awl grip with double white stripes and black anti-fouling

Deck:   Manufacturer's Description: W hite, off-white or sand gelcoated deck with patterned, contrasting non-skid. Hand laminated sandwich composite of polyester resin, uni-directional "E" glass and end grain balsa core. All hardware installation points are solid glass backed with aluminum plate or FRP backing plates. Joined to hull using stainless steel fasteners that are drilled and tapped into aluminum backing plates molded into hull flange, spaced to meet ABS specification for offshore sailing yachts. Bonded with 3M 5200™ sealant.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
Lauren Marie is a two owner dark blue example of this great power cruiser design from Beneteau; the largest boat builder in the world.  Two staterooms and two heads plus great living spaces inside and outside make this design a compelling cruising boat.

She is fully equipped with generator, dual reverse cycle air conditioning/heat, galley up, and full electronics suite including GPS/Chartplotters at both stations plus autopilot, radar, VHF radio and many options. Twin 370hp Yanmars deliver reliability and a 20 knot cruise. A bow thruster makes close quarters handling even that much easier. Teak decks and a bimini on the flybridge enhance your experience outdoors.. .

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Two staterooms below and a convertible settee in the pilothouse combine to sleep six.  The owners stateroom has a large center island double with hatch overhead.  The Guest cabin has a large double bed.  Two heads with two toilets and a shower below provide gracious accommodations for two couples. Up a couple of stairs, the pilothouse is bright and airy and features a large settee and table to starboard with the up-galley opposite. The lower helm is to starboard with a double bench seat and two sliding doors provide easy access to the side decks. This is the ideal layout for a couple cruising and for entertaining. The interior is warm and inviting with teak flooring, and Cherry stained Alpi wood cabinetry.

  • Headroom 6' 5"

The Galley is conveniently located up in the salon and is finished in exquisit cabinetry. Even the refrigerator door is wood and blends in to this beautiful space. Prepare meals as you would at home with 3 burner Eno cooktop with  separate Eno oven, and broiler.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Electrical and Options
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
110vAC and 12vDC systems are powered by a custom distribution panel. 2 engine start batteries and 4 house batteries are charged by a 40 amp charger and engine alternators. 9KW Onan generator is installed for charging and to run air conditioning/heating system when off the dock. 110 outlets are located in each cabin, salon, and galley. 50 amp shore power cord.

  • 9  kw Onan generator
  • Maxpower Bow Thruster - 6 hp with controls both helms
  • Simpson Lawrence vertical anchor windlass
  • Mast and hoist for dinghy
  • Cruisair Air conditioner/heating system - two zones
  • Dolphin 40 amp battery charger
  • Jabsco electric toilets
  • Extra refrigerator on Flybridge
  • Windshield defogger
  • Trim tabs with indicators
  • Deck washdown pump
  • Hot and cold cockpit shower
  • Water heater with 110vAC exchanger
  • 2 electric bilge pumps
  • 3 electric windshield wipers with integrated washing jet (center wiper not working)
  • Holding tank with deck/sea pump out
  • Windshield washer system
  • Windshield defrosters
  • 12v sockets at both helms
  • Receptacle in cockpit for TV/Phone

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Mechanical and Plumbing
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Mechanical:

  • 2 Yanmar 370 hp diesels (approx. 980 hours)
  • 9 kw Onan generator in sound shield
  • Dripless Shaft Seals
  • Volvo single lever engine controls
  • 4 blade propellers
  • 2 Auto Fire Extinguishing systems
  • Fuel filters with decanter
  • Sea water intake strainers
  • 2 Fuel tanks aluminum are interconnected
  • Lenco trim tabs with indicator
  • Rudder angle indicator

Plumbing:

  • Two Jabsco electric toilets 
  • Hydraulic steering
  • 1 Manual bilge pump
  • Electric bilge pump
  • Hot and cold cockpit shower
  • One propane tank
  • Extra sink on flybridge

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Exterior
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Hull is dark blue with a white boot stripe and red anti-fouling paint.

Large deck surfaces forward with sun cushions, large cockpit, and large flybridge provide ample space for fun outdoors. Wide side decks and bulwarks and a high bow rail with mid-rail wire make going forward easy and safe. A transom door leads into the cockpit from the swim platform. Sliding doors from the salon to the cockpit and two sliding doors to the side decks port and starboard bring the outside into the salon and make short handed operation easier. Two hull gates at the midships doors facilitate docking. The second helm station on the flybridge is set with lots of seating, a sink with pressure water, extra refrigerator, table, electronics, and a bimini.  A mast with tabernacle folds to reduce air draft and serves to lift and store the dinghy with an manual hoist winch. 

  • 4 opening deck hatches with screens and shades
  • Stainless anchor sprit
  • Stainless bow guard
  • Stainless double bow rail
  • Stainless grab rails
  • Stainless ladder to flybridge
  • Stainless swim ladder
  • Mast with tabernacle - max height off the water - 23' (hinges down to 13')
  • Delta Fast Set plow anchor with all chain
  • Canvas flybridge helm cover
  • Blue bimini over flybridge
  • Canvas around the flybridge railings
  • Deck chairs - folding teak
  • Fenders and dock lines
  • Lifejackets

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription: One owner, well maintained very desirable Shamrock 290 with preferred twin Yanmar diesel 230 HP engines. This is a fully appointed boat that has been well loved. Full Canvas enclosure and swim platform make this a comfortable and fun boat. Twin Yanmar diesels are economical and reliable.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Manufacturer Provided Description
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description: The Shamrock 290 Walkaround features a high-tech helm with full instrumentation, dual binnacle controls, and plenty of room to accommodate optional electronics. The transom features a 38-gallon baitwell with light, a large insulated fish box with macerator pump-out, a large swing-out transom door with a flip-up lid to accommodate larger catches, and full cockpit bolsters. A power actuated engine hatch makes engine inspections easy. The large walkaround area allows for easy access to the bow area featuring an anchor locker, dunnage box, and forward seating. Other fishing amenities include a bait prep station with freshwater sink, five tackle drawers, cutting board, and storage area under the seat. The interior cabin features cherry wood cabinetry, a hanging locker, a dinette, and sleeping for four. The galley comes complete with microwave, sink, electric stove, refrigerator, storage cabinet and drawers. The back of the lounge seat flips up to become a sleeping bunk and additional storage can be found behind and below the lower bunk. An enclosed, standup head comes with a sink, vanity, shower, opening port, and screen.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
World reknowned yacht builder, Beneteau, does it again! Debuting this October in Annapolis at the International Sailboat Show, the new Oceanis 41 continues to deliver incomparable volume and a design with stretched, clear lines. This new generation hull delivers comfortable, fast sailing.

Key Features:

A continuous chine hull: This design provides for stiff performance on a slight heel while being fast, and providing a comfortable, very wide cockpit with a spacious forecabin.

More light than ever before and wonderful ventilation. The Oceanis line brings PMMA door and companionwah hatch with plexiglass windows to either side of the campanionway maximizing light and views below.

Electric opening transom: When opened, the transom becomes a spacious bathing platform making the entire cockpit open for wonderful use and connection to the sea. When closed, the transom becomes a helm seat protection the cockpit and increasing the interior volume.

Fixed arch provides a balanced sail plan allowing the mast to be set back 50% of LOA. Better performance and balance that also reduces pitching. The repositioning of the mast allows for a more gradual companionway at only 45 degrees.

Sail drive engine = less noise, more power and Dock & Go compatible.

Plan a visit with us today to see this wonderful new series of Oceanis yachts.

.This is your chance to buy a boat that retailed for $1.2 million dollars for less than $600k

This boat is fully equipped with tons of options. Her previous owner spared no expense in her care. You will not find a nicer example that has been better maintained.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Steering System
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description: Joystick Control

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Features
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Aft Deck:

Designed for entertaining, the cockpit of the 48 Cantius comes fully equipped with a refrigerator, Ice maker, grill and abundant storage. U-shaped eating easily converts to a comfy sun lounge, both port and starboard entry to the cockpit form the wide 15" side deck landings.

 

Helm:

This cutting edge navigational center offers complete views and unique command of the vessel and monitoring of the twin Volvo IPS 600 engines. Volvo Penta IPS engines with joystick maneuvering are standard and ensure more efficient and responsive handling. Standard is a double helm seat with flip up bolster. Standard for 2012 is a two-piece solid windshield featuring double windshield wipers. This boat comes with the optional large walk-through windshield with a single windshield wiper and  a manual opening air vent on the walk through door. Both windshields come with port and starboard power air vents whet the side windows meet the windshields and come with blackout privacy screens that attach from the outside to compliment the easy pull-down shades throughout the inside of the remainder of the helm area.

 

Upper Salon:

The 48 Cantius' double salons are designed to invite onboard entertaining. The upper salon can easily host six guests and comes standard with a wet bar including sink, a 32" Sony Bravia TV, a power-actuated 71" by 71" sunroof with manual sun shade and tri-slide upper salon glass door for 360 degree visibility and 165 square feet of enclosed glass. Also standard, a double helm seat featuring flip-up bolsters and companion seat. The companion seat converts to a lounge and offers a multi-functioning dinette table.

 

Lower Salon:

Below deck, the traditional disconnect between the upper helm and lower salon no longer exists. The lower salon features a standard L-shaped sofa.

As a result of the seamless integration of the upper helm and the lower salon you will enjoy an abundance of natural light that pours into the galley through the open dash.

 

Galley:

At the galley's entrance, raised ceilings offer just under 7' of headroom. The inventive port side galley is furnished with an upright stainless steel refrigerator and freezer, microwave/convection oven, electric stove, double sink and plenty of storage for supplies. A Standard 15.5KW generator supports four air conditioning and heating units to keep you comfortable and extra-large below-deck hull ports amplify visibility in the galley and are frameless and post-glazed for deeper, richer aesthetic.

 

Master Stateroom:

With 6'6" of headroom, the full beam master stateroom features a queen-sized island berth with a therapeutic foam mattress accessible from both the port and starboard sides. Two full-length cedar-lined closets and a large built-in dresser on the starboard side offer ample storage, perfect for long cruises. This boat has the optional washer/dryer combo.

 

Master Head:

The master stateroom also offers a private head with separate shower stall. A large vanity sits outside the head compartment with solid-surface countertops and storage above and below. Hull ports above the vanity and built-in dresser capture natural light, illuminating the master stateroom.

 

Forward Stateroom:

Elegant amenities are what give Cruisers Yachts style and legendary comfort and the 48 Cantius is no exception. The forward stateroom boasts a queen-size island berth accessible from either the port or starboard side, with storage below and private access to both the head and shower. Two built-in full-length cedar-lined closets provide additional storage.

Forward head:

Guests will appreciate the private entrances to the day head and split shower from the stateroom. Plus the day head is also accessible from the lower salon.

DealerParty.SpecialRemarksDescription:
Kevin Fraser Kevin developed a passion for boating as a child on Cape Cod. While a student at Massachusetts Maritime Academy (MMA), Kevin was a member of the offshore sailing team. Upon graduation from MMA, He served as a Deck Officer on Oil Tankers and as Captain on various Yachts and a racing sailboat. Later, Kevin worked for Lewmar Marine, selling winches and deck hardware to Large OEM's and Custom Race boats. He continues to use his USCG Master Mariner license to deliver boats, to and from Florida. Kevin currently sails competitively on a custom 55‚ racing sailboat. "If you would like to talk to me about a new or brokerage boat, please give me a call."

Mobile: 401-862-0297 and email: kevin@cape-yachts.com.

Kevin Fraser

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription: Rarely does a boat Like Forever Young come along. This Beneteau 423 is an exceptional blue water cruiser built with a wonderful combination of brawn and beauty. Below decks the attention to detail is exceptional and above decks the high grade marine fittings and innovative features make single handling a dream. This is a recent trade to Cape Yachts and well worth a closer inspection.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
As you walk down the companionway into this spectacular yacht you'll feel the attention to detail in her wood working throughout. The settee to starboard has a subtle curve with plenty of seating and storage. To port the functional galley with Adler Barbour freezer and refrigerator, three burner stove makes cooking meals a dream. Aft of the galley is the one of the 2 roomy heads, and aft of this are the two 6'8" double berths cabins. Moving forward the owners stateroom offers 7'7" length berth with a private head and separate shower.

The entire boat offers skylights with privacy curtains and portlights throughout. Bright and airy makes the feeling of cramped quarters disappear.

Moody 425 Hull profile hauled and covered

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
OFF DUTY II is a well updated version of this respected long distance center cockpit cruiser from Moody.   The current owner has updated this boat with expensive gear including new Vacuflush toilets with new plumbing, updated electronics, sails, and canvas.   Additional equipment includes Raymarine color chartploter/radar at the helm, speed/wind/depth instruments, an updated linear drive autopilot, VHF radio and remote command mic and a Graphic repeater at the nav station.

The layout of OFF DUTY II is great for extended cruises and for live-aboard.   In three private staterooms, there is a centerline berth aft, a vee berth with insert forward, over/under bunk beds in the passageway to starboard, and the main salon has a straight settee berth to port and a convertible double settee to starboard.

Some light cosmetic chores remain for the next owner but this boat is reported to be functionally ready for cruising safely and reliably now.  Call today for additional information and an appointment to see OFF DUTY II in person.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Off Duty II has a great layout for extended cruising and for live-aboard use.  There are three private cabins with a large Centerline Island Double berth aft, a large Vee Berth with insert forward, and two bunks in a passageway cabin to starboard.   Adding to the sleeping capacity is a single settee berth to port in the main salon and a convertible stbd settee will make up to an intimate double.   Sleep up to nine (9) family and friends if you want to.

The Fwd Cabin with vee berth has private access to one of two heads.   The Fwd Head is accessible from the main salon as well and has a Vacuflush toilet, tank level indicator, sink vanity, and teak grate.  The Main Salon features a long straight settee to port and a U-shaped settee to stbd which may convert to a berth.  A teak table is in the center and has two leaves which fold out to sit a crowd for dinner. 

The L-shaped Galley is to port and convenient to the main salon and cockpit without being in the way.   Two round stainless steel sinks have hot and cold pressure water along with salt and fresh water foot pumps.  A cutting board cover is on one of the sinks.  Two large ice boxes are top load and the aft one has Adler Barbour refrigerator and freezer.  There is a Force 10 two burner, propane stove with oven at the aft of the galley and a Microwave oven under the cockpit overhang.  A waste basket bin is fitted with through counter access.  Stainless steel stove guards and grab rails fitting for cooking offshore.  There is plenty of storage including a sliding locker and separate utensil drawer.

There is a forward facing Navigation Station to stbd and this is where the main electrical panel is located along with instrument repeaters and VHF radio.  Just aft to stbd in the passage to the aft cabin is a private cabin with over/under bunks. 

The Aft Stateroom is spacious and includes a seat to stbd, island double berth on center, a vanity  with make-up mirror to port and a TV with Satelite reception.   There are springs under the mattress for added comfort and a full length mirror is mounted to stbd.   In the passageway to port is a walk-through Owner's Head with a bi-fold clear acrylic door that creates a shower stall.  A Vacuflush toilet,sink vanity, and teak grate are installed and there is a large hamper for wet clothes.  

The interior is oiled teak throughout with varnished teak and holly sole.   The cushions in the main salon are gorgeous and supple off-white Ultraleather.  Berth cushions are upholstered with a blue velour.   There are ample storage lockers and stowage abounds.   Five overhead opening deck hatches, a number of opening portlights, four cowl vents, a passive vent,two active solar vents and large fixed windows in the main salon area provide plenty of light and an airy feeling below.   Soft Ivory Ultraleather main salon cushions (2010)

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Broker Comments and Disclaimer
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
OFF DUTY II is owned by knowledgeable boaters who have spent a lot of money on important upgrades since they purchased her in 2006.  Upgrades include Vacuflush toilets and new plumbing, electronics, sails, and canvas.  The boat is serviceable today with systems reported working.  With some minor attention to cosmetics this Moody 425 could be ready to take you far and wide.   OFF DUTY II was not in the water summer 2014 and sellers are getting out of sailing so take advantage of their upgrades and call to make an appointment to see this rare center cockpit today.

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
Defined by her dark blue hull, the new Oceanis 60 embraces the sensational spirit of the super-yacht. With an unusual deck plan and an interior complemented by quality materials and an elegant finish, she combines the comfort of life at sea with the pleasure and relaxation of anchoring. The Seven Seas are yours!


The Oceanis 60’s hull line is not only attractive but has also been perfected to reduce the heel angle and optimize sailing performance. The stemhead gracefully extends the bow of the yacht, which cuts through the waves with style and distinction. Perfectly balanced, the Oceanis 60 is fitted with a mainsail arch, range renewal signature, which boasts the largest cockpit of its generation.


The rear deck has been completely updated and now extends the outdoor living space and reinvents the magnificence of sunbathing. Below deck, once the bathing platform automatically closes off the dedicated dinghy storage area, the boat is ready to sail.


Let yourself be guided inside by gently sloping large steps to the luxurious and luminous interior. Lined with brushed anthracite-, ingenious fittings and glossy woodwork, the Oceanis 60 is fit for royalty and promises comfort and well-being.


Outstandingly equipped with your choice of a three or four cabin version, the flagship of the latest generation of Oceanis’ will accommodate and impress your family and friends.

DealerParty.SpecialRemarksDescription:
Kevin Fraser Kevin developed a passion for boating as a child on Cape Cod. While a student at Massachusetts Maritime Academy (MMA), Kevin was a member of the offshore sailing team. Upon graduation from MMA, He served as a Deck Officer on Oil Tankers and as Captain on various Yachts and a racing sailboat. Later, Kevin worked for Lewmar Marine, selling winches and deck hardware to Large OEM's and Custom Race boats. He continues to use his USCG Master Mariner license to deliver boats, to and from Florida. Kevin currently sails competitively on a custom 55‚ racing sailboat. "If you would like to talk to me about a new or brokerage boat, please give me a call."

Mobile: 401-862-0297 and email: kevin@cape-yachts.com.

Kevin Fraser

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
LIGHT DAWNS is a beautiful example of this fast and accommodating Bruce Farr Beneteau cruiser. The Beneteau 461 was awarded BEST BOAT OF THE YEAR honors in 1997 and shares a hull form from the very successful Bruce Farr First 45s5 but with a more manageable cruising rig.  Known to be an excellent performance cruiser, Light Dawns has been lightly used.    Never south, this boat has sailed New England and in two of the last three summers has remained hauled and decommissioned due to the owners's schedule.  Light Dawns is in the water now and fully commissioned.  

Light Dawns has the Two Stateroom/two head layout which locates the galley in aft stbd corner, connected to the main salon but out of the way.  The interior spaces are large and include a center-island berth and en suite head in the master stateroom, and extra large main salon with convertible dinette, sit-down nav station, second head aft conveniently located close to the companionway, and an oversized double aft stateroom.  Berths come with custom fitted bedding and linens.  The galley includes both top and front load freezer/refrigerator, three burner propane stove with oven and broiler, microwave oven, and lots of counter and storage space for meal prep. 

Well equipped, she has a stainless steel radar arch over the transom which integrates dinghy haul-out tackles, a wind generator, a solar panel, and the radar scanner.   The wind gen and solar panel couple to maintain battery charge even when cruising off the dock for extended periods.  

Light Dawns is easily sailed short-handed with all sail controls led back to the cockpit and controlled by an electric winch.  She is outfitted with in-mast furling, roller furling genoa, and a cruising spinnaker with carbon fiber pole.   A full electronics suite includes GPS-chartplotter, radar, autopilot, VHF radio with command mic at the helm, sailing instruments and stereo.   

The Seller has reduced the price to a very competitive level and wants his 461 to be the next boat sold.  This is a compelling value.   Please call today for additional details and a chance to view this highly recommended cruiser.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Light Dawns offers a large volume, live-able interior with the desirable two double berth stateroom layout which includes a convertible berth in the salon and two heads. The Master Cabin is forward and has a center-island berth. Shelves run the length of the varnished hull ceiling strips.  There is a large hanging locker to port and additional lockers, bins, and drawers provide ample storage. There is direct access to the forward head and shower. Two dressing benches, overhead hatches, and hull ports make this space bright and airy and inviting.  The Main Salon features a very large, U-shaped starboard settee with centerline bench which surround a table large enough to sit eight for dinner.  In addition, there is a long settee opposite to port with an aft-facing navigation station at the end.  At the forward end of the port settee is an extra large storage cabinet.  Storage is found in this cabinet, in lockers outboard to port and stbd, and under the settees including the center bench.  Aft of the main salon to port is a day head with shower with access from the main salon and privately from the Aft Stateroom. This cabin includes a very large double bed, two opening portlights, an overhead opening hatch and a fixed hull light which combine to make the space feel light and comfortable.  The Galley is located aft to starboard and is conveniently close to the companionway and open to the main salon without being in the way. Fully equipped for meal prep and entertaining with front loading refrigerator, top loading freezer, three burner propane stove with oven and broiler, microwave, double polished stainless steel sink, pull-out metal bin storage, large dry storage bin, outboard lockers, a waste bin accessible through counter, and lots of counter space.

The interior is finished beautifully in varnished teak and the sole is varnished teak with black striping. The many overhead hatches, hull ports, opening portlights, and 6'5" headroom give a sense of light and spaciousness. This is not a typical sailboat cave.

  • 12v Adler Barbour front-load refrigerator and top-load freezer
  • Force 10 three burner, stainless steel, propane stove with oven and broiler
  • One propane bottle in dedicated locker with capacity for two bottles
  • GE Turntable Microwave oven
  • Polished stainless steel double basin sink
  • Hot and cold pressure water
  • Tons of galley storage including slide out metal baskets
  • Seven overhead deck hatches - with shades and screens
  • Numerous opening portlights and fixed hull lights
  • Grab rails and hand rails and high fiddles add a measure of safety for moving around below when underway 
  • Cushions are blue

  • Raymarine RL 70C Pathfinder GPS chartplotter / radar display at Nav Station
  • C-Map chip from Passamaquoddy to Montauk
  • Radar with dome mounted on arch
  • Raytheon 6000+ autopilot

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Electrical
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Boat is wired for both 12vDC "ship" and 110vAC "shore power" systems. Custom electrical breaker panels are located centrally at the nav station. Four batteries included in two banks for engine start and house. (Three batteries are 4-D size marine deep cycle and the engine start is a Group 27). Charging is through an engine alternator, by 110vAC battery charger, solar panel, and wind generator. Heart Interface Link 1000 installed for battery monitor.

  • Three 4-D batteries in house and one Group 27 in engine start bank
  • Electic Energy 12v wind generator
  • 12v Solar Panel
  • Combination of halogen, fluorescent, and incandesent lights
  • Low level courtesy lights
  • Light at cockpit table

DealerParty.SpecialRemarksDescription:
Bob Chace My passion for the ocean began when I spent 4 years at sea in the Navy. I have travelled the world aboard the LST-1181 and LST-1190. After a career in banking I have decided to turn to my true love, the sea. I look forward to helping you purchase the boat of your dreams.

Mobile: 401-588-2385 and email: bchace@cape-yachts.com.

Bob Chace

VehicleRemarketingBoat.GeneralBoatDescription:
First Light is a first rate example of a well maintained Pearson 35. She has been lovingly maintained by her owners and is available for sale because her owners have decided to fly south, forever. This is a turnkey boat that you will be able to sail for the rest of this summer and for many summers to come.

The Pearson 35 is an extraordinarily successful design, over 500 were built from 1968 to 1981 and most are still in use. The Pearson 35 has a long full keel with centerboard which provides shoal draft making it possible to venture into places much smaller boats would hesitate going. The Pearson 35 is a very popular, well built boat with great resale value.

Life is short, let's go sailing!

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Accommodations
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
Accomodations are very efficient and comfortable, the vee berth with filler and cushions makes a very comfortable forward cabin. Shelves for personal items are above and outboard of the vee birth. In the vee recess are drawers  and lockers with a bureau to port and small hanging locker to starboard. The overhead translucent hatch provides ample light and ventilation.

Aft of the forward cabin to port is the head with basin and stowage under the sink and outboard. There is a shower (HCPW) and a main hanging locker.

The main cabin has a bureau forward to starboard with a small locker, top and bottom. The boat is designed with a pilot berth above and outboard of the starboard settee. The settee pulls out to form a single berth while the port settee pulls out to a tight double with three large storage compartments behind.

Aft is the galley with a refrigerator by Adler Barbour to starboard. There is a sink, three-burner Shipmate alcohol shove with oven. There is plenty of storage for pots and pans, utensils, plates, glasses and condiments. Large lockers and an open bookshelf provide even more storage.

Patty Sue II has been Captain maintained and only had one owner in her time on the water.  This 2009 Sea Ray 43 is truly a 47 footer with no options spared, TV's in every room and even one in the cockpit which is only the beginning.  Here are a few more features of note:

  • Cummins Mercruiser QSB 480 w/ Zeus Pod Drives
  • Dark Cherry Wood in Salon
  • Stainless Steel Anchor w/ all chain
  • AC including a 16,000 btu Cockpit AC
  • Twin E 120 Displays with an Open Array Radar
  • Underwater Lights
  • Cummins Onan 13.5kw Genset
  • ACR Spotlight
  • Central Vac
  • KVH M5 Tracvision Sat TV reciever
  • Passport Warranty good through 2015

There are many more options you will have to see to believe.  With a year left on the passport warranty this gives you a first year aboard with no worries.  Call to schedule an appointment to see this immaculate, low hour, turn key boat today!

Just Reduced!!! Highly Motivated Seller!

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Manufacturer Provided Description
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description:
The 43 Sundancer comes standard with twin Cummins MerCruiser QSB 425 diesels (425 hp - 313 kW) mated to Zeus drives — individually articulating pods that offer up to 15 percent better fuel economy and 15 percent faster top speeds than regular inboards. Plus, the Zeus-equipped 43 Sundancer provides a more comfortable ride because gear noise and vibration are significantly reduced. Optional power includes twin Cummins MerCruiser QSB 480 diesels (474 hp - 353 kW) with Zeus drives. Above the waterline, the 43 Sundancer is everything that discriminating boat owners have come to expect from the definitive express cruiser series on the water. It starts with a trademark reverse sheer line, below which are two oversize hull windows and 10 portlights. A hardtop integrates seamlessly with the windshield for the ultimate in weather protection and climate control (16,000-BTU helm air conditioning/heating is optional), yet you can still let the sun shine in thanks to two retractable skylights.

The captain will enjoy that sunny warmth from a double-wide helm seat with flip-up bolster and armrests. It slides and adjusts vertically in front of the gel-coated dash with SmartCraft VesselView Display and MerCruiser digital throttle and shift. To port, guests can lounge on the big L-shaped bench. The seating options continue in the cockpit, which boasts a U-shaped lounge flanking a convenient fiberglass table; a wet bar opposite features a solid-surface countertop, sink and icemaker — or you can opt up to the removable flatscreen TV, stainless-steel barbecue grill and refrigerator.

At its heart, the 43 Sundancer is a boat that will make owners feel comfortable in any situation, whether it be driving, docking, entertaining, or cruising with friends and family. And since it comes with a free membership in the Sea Ray Owners Club, which offers great money-saving benefits and endless fun experiences like owners’ rendezvous and dock parties, the newest sport yacht will have ample opportunity to show off its slick handiwork.

AdditionalDetailDescription.Title: Additional Description
AdditionalDetailDescription.Description: Below deck, the 43 Sundancer features a functional (and absolutely gorgeous) split stateroom plan, each with a wood privacy door. The forward master pampers owners in an island-style bed, from which they can watch the flatscreen HDTV with remote DVD player. Cruising couples will be amazed at the storage ? under the berth, in gunwale cabinets, in two hanging lockers, in the floor ? and they?ll also love the individual head and shower compartments, port and starboard, both with tile flooring. The mid-stateroom has two twin beds that convert to a queen, so it?s perfect for kids or grown-up guests. Along with a hanging locker, overnighters here will appreciate a private head and shower compartment; the vanity is separate and includes a solid-surface countertop, mirror, sink and storage. In between the two staterooms, the salon and galley have all the modern indulgences of a refined seaside condominium. There?s optional wood flooring and Ultraleather HP seating; a 26-inch flatscreen HDTV with DVD player and stereo with six-disk CD changer; wood blinds and high-gloss cherry interior (either regular or dark). The galley is designed to make life as easy as possible for the onboard chef, sporting designated storage for cutlery, plates, and glasses. Full stainless-steel appliances add more than a touch of luxury.
